column4: a while ago I installed Ubuntu on my Windows computer - dualboot. I still have the partition of it, and the old Ubuntu should still be there, but somehow I changed it so that Windows starts automatically without giving me the choice. Is there a way to boot in Ubuntu?
if you hold shift at boot, can you select Ubuntu?
never tried that - I do a reboot, and then start pressing shift ?
yes as soon as the system starts to turn on
